column3: Description

Government council formed to advance Alberta’s autonomy within Canada.
Facebook group.

The Alberta Prosperity Project is an advocacy group advancing an independent Alberta. They wish to hold a referendum on Alberta sovereignty and create a new constitution. Members traveled to Washington in spring and fall of 2025 to meet with U.S. officials in regard to an independent Alberta's relationship with the U.S.
United Conservative Party MLA from Drayton Valley-Devon. ● Voted for Bill 14
Republican Congressman from Tennessee. Said that Albertans would "prefer not to be a part of Canada and be a part of the United States because we [the U.S.] are winning day in and day out."

Created by Rob Anderson, Barry Cooper and Derek From, this strategy group seeks "a strong, free & sovereign Alberta within Canada". Their stated aims include: ● "Establishing complete Provincial Legislative Sovereignty within Canada". ● "Absolute discretion to refuse to enforce any piece of federal legislation or judicial decision that intrudes on Alberta’s provincial rights".

Co-founder of the Alberta Prosperity Project who has claimed to have been offered $500M, then $500B from U.S. officials for an independent Alberta, while calling for Alberta to become the 51st state. In constant conflict with other independence groups, and even his own group. A lawyer, he has taken several COVID-related cases and is currently in disciplinary hearings with the Law Society of Alberta

The American political operative has mused about the potential steps Alberta could take from referendum to American statehood. “...it seems hard to believe that Washington would ultimately abide an independent, energy rich Alberta indefinitely at its border.”

Some members of the U.S. Republican Party have expressed interest in Alberta joining the United States, while president Donald Trump has made mixed statements advocating for the annexation of Canada.

The UCP, Alberta's ruling party, contains many members who have expressed interest in sovereignty and/or separatism. 

Their leader, Danielle Smith, calls for a "free & sovereign Alberta within Canada", and enabled the independence movement to bypass Alberta's courts and force through a referendum.
● Called "pro-independence" by Alberta Prosperity Project ● Attended Alberta Prosperity independence rally
Former leader of the Independent Party of Alberta, a pro independence party.

Though not avowedly separatist, the Western Standard is the most influential media voice for the Alberta separatist movement.

The support many of the policies advanced by independence and sovereigntist groups, such as an Alberta tax agency, provincial police force and pension plan. Their coverage is highly critical of the federal government under the Liberals and anything perceived "woke". It is supportive of gun rights, free speech, and western autonomy.

Current Alberta provincial party formed in 2020 as a merger between two previous parties. They
